citeinfo.origin: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Environmental Satellite, Data and Information Service (NESDIS), National Oceanographic Data Center (NODC), Library and Information Services Division (LISD)
citeinfo.title: Sea Surface Temperature, Salinity, Sea Ice, Color, and Depth During Expedition of Veda From Nordkap to Bering Strait (1878)

descript.abstract:
Author and title of this book: (in Swedish) Om Mojlighetten Att Idka Sjofart I Det Sibirska Ishafvt On Possibility of Navigation in Sibirian Ice Call number: C /ka N 832 19349
Number of books: 1
This book is a part of the foreign meteorological data collection held by the NOAA Central Library in Washington, DC. Information in this collection dates back to the 18th century for daily, monthly, seasonal, and annual tabular summaries, and the 19th century for weather maps. These data are the result of foreign exchange agreements, but the collection has not been updated since 1983.
In these summaries, definitions are:
1. Hourly/daily/monthly/seasonal/annual data -- values determined for each consecutive period, e.g. monthly temperature data: January 1900, February 1900, etc.
2. Long-term data -- values determined over a period of years, e.g. long-term monthly temperature data using January 1901, January 1902, etc.
This book contains graphs of seawater / freshwater content in the ice vs. temperature, changes in the volumes of the freshwater ice between 0 deg and -1 deg, volumes of one cubical centimeter of fresh and salt water at different temperatures, hourly temperature-salinity-depth sections, water color, and ice along the route of "Veda" expedition form Nordkap to Bering Straits in 1878.
Graphs contain the following data:
-volumes of one cubic centimeter of fresh and salt water Vs state of the ice -changes in the volume of the fresh water ice between 0 degrees and -1 degree -volumes of one cubical centimeter of fresh and salt water at different temperatures
Maps contain the following data:
-hourly salinity-temperature-depth for August-September -daily sea surface temperature and salinity -daily sea water color, depth, and ice
descript.purpose: A report showing the Sea Surface Temperature, Salinity, Sea Ice, Color, and Depth During Expedition of Veda From Nordkap to Bering Strait (1878)
